info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 11:08PM MDT until July 17 at 2:00AM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, southeastern Larimer.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Debris flows causing minor flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 1105 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Alexander Mountain Burn Area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen.
- Alexander Mountain burn area north of Highway 34 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cedar Cove.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Excessive runoff from this storm will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows in the Alexander Mountain burn area.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY FOR THE ALEXANDER MOUNTAIN BURN SCAR IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MDT THURSDAY
